DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Concentration Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number that represents the concentration of the normal control sample measured in micrograms per microliters.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Sample Normal Control Extracted DNA Concentration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another._A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._A measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

Concepts.definition: A piece of tissue removed from an organism for examination, analysis, or propagation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.:A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.:A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information. :A measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

Concepts.definition: Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The act of directing or determining; regulation or maintenance of a function or action; a relation of constraint of one entity (thing or person or group) by another.
A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by T.Lichtenberg. mc 10/5/11 Versioned to change OC from Tumor Tissue to Tissue Sample per request by Tara. mc 12/30/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance._A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information._A measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A solution of essential constituents of a complex material; a substance removed from another substance.
A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.

The quantity of a substance per unit volume or weight; a measure of the amount of substance present in a unit amount of mixture, particularly, the amount of solute dissolved in a solvent. The amounts can be expressed as moles, masses, volumes, or parts.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
